intro: Cakile edentula subvar. apetala, commonly known as the barren leaf sandbur, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It has reduced leaves and lacks the typical leaf structure seen in other members of its species. This subvariety is notable for its unique morphology and ecological resilience.
